newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends up on USDA revised soy data, Japan.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends up on USDA revised soy data, Japan.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended higher on revised U.S. Department of Agriculture soybean stocks data, traders said.
"We're up on the USDA cutting 22 million bushels," a trader said of USDA's news Tuesday that March 1 U.S. soybean stocks totalled 1.056 billion bushels, not the 1.078 billion it reported Monday.

"There were late hedges in May and July. Japan bought 300 May at the close," a trader said. May WCE futures crush profit margin fell to -15.62 Tuesday from -11.56 Monday. About 700 July-Nov spread $70, May-Nov $66, May-July $3. Volume 8,030.
Japan bought 5,000-7,000 tonnes overnight, sources said.
May rose $6.10 to $433.70 and July ended up $7.50 at $436.50 after jumping the $10 per tonne limit early.
May flax closed $0.10 higher at $356.10 and July lost $0.90 to $354 in light activity. Oats did not trade.
July western barley rose $0.30 to $142 on commission demand, December rose $0.40 to $140.80 on commercial buying. About 400 May-July spread $0.80 to $0.50. Volume was 1,700.
May feed wheat lost $0.50 to $171, July fell $0.80 at $168 on commission and local demand. About 25 May-July spread at $2.50. Volume was 300.
Ten May feed pea contracts rose US$3.40 at US$216.50 with UGG and PCTS selling to commercials, traders said.
(All values in Canadian dollars per tonne except feed peas)
